data.title: Feels like you are in a beautiful library
data.text: I stopped by accident and loved it and have been back many times since.  The atmosphere is like being in a fine library in someone's home.  I love the decor and the food was excellent also.

data.title: Casual Dining at Its Best!
data.text: The Lunch Box is more than its name would suggest. My first experience was attending a baby shower on a Sunday afternoon. After that, the Lunch Box became my favorite lunch place! Their sandwiches, salads and wraps are always fresh and delicious -- and they are always served with a cookie on the side! For newcomers, you go to the counter to order, and then a server will bring the food to your table. Besides lunches, the Lunch Box serves dinners, caters, and holds other special events. We were delighted with the food preparation, decorations and service when we hosted a wedding reception at the Lunch Box a few years ago. This family-owned and run business works hard to make every experience a memorable one!

data.title: Great atmosphere and lots of choices
data.text: This little gem sits just off main street.  The food menu is huge for the size of the eatery.  I suggest you try the turkey and cranberry wrap.  The steak also got great reviews at our table.  Don't forget that you will get a cookie with you meal, but save some room for a specialty dessert.  Or just go for dessert.  That works too.

data.title: Casual chic at The Lunch Box
data.text:
The Lunch Box is my favorite place for lunch in downtown Visalia.  Located in a classic old storefront, it boasts exposed beams and sunny windows, with a giant chalkboard filled with excellent menu choices.  My favorite is the Cranberry Cream Cheese Turkey Croissant...think Thanksgiving dinner in a yummy sandwich.  Guests order at the counter; meals are served at the table of your choice.  Each tablescape includes fresh flowers and a selection of interesting picture books.  (I introduced my young granddaughters to Calvin and Hobbes here.)  

The food is always fresh, and each entree includes a cookie for dessert.  They offer sandwiches, wraps, salads, and beautiful bakery items, as well as individually brewed coffees and serve- yourself lemonade and tea.  

They also feature a "family table" where people who are eating alone can join others for a meal and conversation.

data.title: Something new
data.text:
Wife and I had to try something new in downtown Visalia. We ordered at the counter then they will deliver food to table. We had the Reuben and Pastrami. Reuben was OK. The pastrami was terrible. It had lots of gristle which is called silver skin before cooking. We mentioned that to our server and finally to one of the owners. She stated they don't process their meats but get it from another company. Doesn't the processor see that? Don't the cooks at the restaurant see that? We both tried to eat it but could not chew that stuff!  
To their credit, both the server and owner did offer to make another type of sandwich but we were on a time frame. 
Another problem for us was how the fries were presented. They came in metal cups like drinking cups. Do they send them through the dishwasher after every service? It would have been nice to have a paper liner in it. 
It does seem that for two ice teas, two sandwiches with fries was expensive $24.00+.
The lack of noticing the serving of silver skin in the pastrami gave the poor rating.

data.title: Ok Food - terrible service
data.text: Clueless defines the service - we were a party of 6 and our food came out in six parts and incorrectly after waiting about 30 minutes for the last sandwich to be served. The food was ok and the restaurant is quaint, clean and comfortable- great iced tea - but would never go back. Don't waste your time unless you have a lot of time!

data.title: Great place for Lunch
data.text: What a great fun place for lunch.   Our first time here, we had great friendly service. Our sandwich and were soup very good.  We'll be back again.

data.title: Don't overlook this gem!
data.text: Just finished our third visit and it keeps getting better. Great sandwiches and salad in a unique atmosphere. Had the Italian panini and it was the best!

data.title: Great for girls lunch.
data.text: My husband and I have been there for lunch but u find it really good for lunch with my girlfriends. Feel like I'm in the Bay Area from the atmosphere.  Great sandwiches and the service is fantastic.

data.title: Put this food in your lunch box.
data.text: I have been here several times and have always had a good lunch.  Sandwiches and wraps are well prepared, the atmosphere is comfortable and spacious.  Great place to meet someone for a meal.

data.title: Interesting menu items
data.text: The fish poke (poh-keh) caught my eye but ordered the Reuben. It took a while for the order to arrive but the taste was good. The pastrami wasn't the best as it was a little stringy with some tough parts here and there.  It came with fries. Would really like to try more menu items but this place looks to be popular.

data.title: Sweet little place for lunch
data.text: This little place has a lovely lunch menu, some of the more "healthy" items.  They were quite busy, and we had to wait a bit, not long, though. I had the "Oriental Chicken Salad" and it was delicious.  This was the first time I had eaten here.

data.title: Nice lunch and dinner choices
data.text: I always enjoy going to The Lunch Box. They have a lunch combo that comes with a beverage that is reasonably priced. They have added items like lasagne, baked potatoes, meatloaf and a lot more if you're craving something more than a sandwhich. If your have little time, you can call ahead, even if you're wanting to eat in, to avoid a wait.  559-635-8624

data.title: Good tea and cookies, Ok sandwiches
data.text: Average sandwiches.  Great customer service.  It took a long time to get our order for 6 ready, so they through in free cookies that were delicious. Tea was very good.   Would eat here again, but just like any other sandwich place  I have been too.

data.title: Excellent Find in Visalia
data.text: Very cute restaurant with great service. Food was quite good as well. Lots of great looking sandwiches, wraps, salads, and soups. Ordered a few of their cookies to go, which were quite addicting. If I happen to be in the area again, would definitely stop by here again.

data.title: Nice spot for lunch
data.text: The Lunch Box is a welcoming, sweetly decorated spot downtown. I had a turkey and avocado sandwich and it was fresh and a good serving size. The free cookie that came with it was fresh and delicious. There are books on the shelves that you can browse, which I love when I'm eating alone.

data.title: Cute
data.text: No table service but a sweetly decorated place for a quick soup & sandwich that's yummy. There are cookies.

data.title: Modern & Antique meet for lunch
data.text: The restored building has exposed beams, high windows and wooden floors which might lead you to believe there is an edgy menu options but not really.  The service was slow from the cashier to the food delivery.  The egg salad I had was good but a little runny. The drinks are self-serve, so I had to turn on the Keurig machine to heat up some hot water for my hot tea.  They do have a nice selection of teas and the meals come with a complementary peanut butter brownie, nice touch.  There was plenty of tables and space in this lofty feeling eatery.

data.title: Lunch
data.text: My wife and I had a great lunch here. The sandwich and soup is a great deal.  The food is great! We like the atmosphere and will definitely visit there again for lunch.

data.title: Self-Order With Table Delivery
data.text: Great for lunch with healthful choices. Generous menu diversity. Free refills on drinks. The décor, as stated is casual, but food is very good. Children okay, but mostly a downtown business lunch crowd. When we must self order, someone must sit with children, while someone else orders for that person. Still, I prefer this site to others in the area.
